lines.text:
[after arriving to break up a street fight and points his shotgun]
Everybody freeze!
[to Tom]
Drop that iron!
[Tom tosses it to the ground, but it ends up hitting one of the workers on the foot]
Or am I going to have to start kicking asses and taking names?
You play, sheriff?
[Serves a tennis ball]
I don't play games.
It's not a game. It's a sport.
Don't have time for them, either.
I told you to arrest the Hunter boy.
[Firmly serves a ball to his opponent]
Not half the people in the valley! You know, sheriff, a lot of folks didn't like the looks of all those old people being brought into town in handcuffs.
You didn't tell me to make any arrests, Mr. Crabtree. I acted on by a complaint from a citizen. You.
What about my bulldozer? You could have held him on that, at least.
I don't know that he did it. Whoever did do it, they did a damn good job. Didn't leave a trace.
I hate to say it, sheriff, but perhaps I should call on the FBI since this sabotage is too much for you local boys.
My oldest brother's in the FBI. You can get back to your game, now, Mr. Crabtree. I'll just be running along.
Just a minute, sheriff. You should take up tennis. You might learn to like it.
Hunter's temper is going to be the death of him.
Maybe we should call the law!
Call the law, hell! Where are those goons?
Tom!
[she slaps Tom across the face enough to almost knock his glasses off]

I read this paper on the plane today coming back from Washington. When I first read it, I got sad. Then I got mad! Ambrose was a friend of mine. Let me tell you something, boy. You better watch out fro the IRS, the internal revenue, everything!

[closing the door]
Good night, Josh.
I'm gonna get you and not good night, good-bye!
Court or no court, Crabtree's paying for this. I'll blow his frickin' head off!

[Tom almost lunges towards Starr]
No, man, cool it. I came here to talk to you. They're coming after you. You got no chance. If I were you, I'd pack up and get out of town.
Well, why should I pay attention to you, asshole?
I don't really give a flying fuck what you want to believe. I've said my piece and I'm getting the hell of here.

[after he gets knocked down by an enraged Tom and and angrily fires his gun in the air]
DON'T FUCK WITH ME!
